trans-unit.source: A helper class for retrieving and comparing standard HTTP methods and for creating new HTTP methods.
The most common usage of <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpMethod> is to use one of the static properties on this class.

However, if an app needs a different value for the HTTP method, the <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.%23ctor%2A> constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpMethod> with an HTTP method that the app specifies.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref> class with a specific HTTP method.

If an app needs a different value for the HTTP method from one of the static properties, the <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.%23ctor%2A> constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpMethod> with an HTTP method that the app specifies.
The HTTP method.
Represents an HTTP DELETE protocol method.
Returns <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The HTTP method to compare with the current object.
`true` if the specified object is equal to the current object; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The object to compare with the current object.
`true` if the specified object is equal to the current object; otherwise, `false`.
Represents an HTTP GET protocol method.
Returns <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref>.
Serves as a hash function for this type.
A hash code is a numeric value that is used to identify an object during equality testing.

It can also serve as an index for an object in a collection.The <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.GetHashCode%2A> method is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Represents an HTTP HEAD protocol method.
The HEAD method is identical to GET except that the server only returns message-headers in the response, without a message-body.
Returns <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref>.
An HTTP method.
An HTTP method represented as a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
The equality operator for comparing two <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref> objects.
The left <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref> to an equality operator.
The right <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref> to an equality operator.
`true` if the specified left and right parameters are equal; otherwise, `false`.
The inequality operator for comparing two <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref> objects.
The left <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref> to an inequality operator.
The right <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref> to an inequality operator.
`true` if the specified left and right parameters are inequal; otherwise, `false`.
Represents an HTTP OPTIONS protocol method.
Returns <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref>.
Represents an HTTP POST protocol method that is used to post a new entity as an addition to a URI.
Returns <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref>.
Represents an HTTP PUT protocol method that is used to replace an entity identified by a URI.
Returns <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref>.
Returns a string that represents the current object.
A string representing the current object.
Represents an HTTP TRACE protocol method.
Returns <xref href="System.Net.Http.HttpMethod"></xref>.
